attributes.comment:
I write as a concerned prospective adoptive parent (PAP). People attempting to
adopt internationally are facing ever increasing wait times due to many factors
ranging from more regulation in the sending country to the increase of the
number of people wishing to adopt from outside the US. While it is not within
the power of the Federal government to reduce this wait time, it is within their
power to prevent the already expensive process from costing even more. Already
most PAPs are being faced with renewing renewing the I171H at least once in
order to continue the pursuit of an adoption. In some cases, two times! For each
time that happens, the couple or individual must spend thousands on homestudy
updates (required both by their state and the USCIS) in addition to the fees for
the new I600A. Please do not add to the burden we already carry by increasing
the amount we must pay in an attempt to make our families complete.
Regards,
Janice Van Slimming
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Janice van Slimming
